channel.title: CVE Feed for ISC -- BIND9
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ISC -- BIND9

item.title: CVE-2020-8620|2024-09-17T01:40:34.573Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: In BIND 9.15.6 -> 9.16.5, 9.17.0 -> 9.17.3, An attacker who can establish a TCP connection with the server and send data on that connection can exploit this to trigger the assertion failure, causing the server to exit.

item.title: CVE-2022-2906|2024-09-17T03:39:00.585Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: An attacker can leverage this flaw to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources. Upon restart the attacker would have to begin again, but nevertheless there is the potential to deny service.

item.title: CVE-2020-8623|2024-09-17T03:19:11.433Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: In BIND 9.10.0 -> 9.11.21, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.5, 9.17.0 -> 9.17.3, also affects 9.10.5-S1 -> 9.11.21-S1 of the BIND 9 Supported Preview Edition, An attacker that can reach a vulnerable system with a specially crafted query packet can trigger a crash. To be vulnerable, the system must: * be running BIND that was built with "--enable-native-pkcs11" * be signing one or more zones with an RSA key * be able to receive queries from a possible attacker

item.title: CVE-2022-2881|2024-09-17T03:59:41.045Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: The underlying bug might cause read past end of the buffer and either read memory it should not read, or crash the process.

item.title: CVE-2022-38177|2024-09-17T00:06:02.235Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed ECDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

item.title: CVE-2022-1183|2024-09-17T04:00:26.575Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: On vulnerable configurations, the named daemon may, in some circumstances, terminate with an assertion failure. Vulnerable configurations are those that include a reference to http within the listen-on statements in their named.conf. TLS is used by both DNS over TLS (DoT) and DNS over HTTPS (DoH), but configurations using DoT alone are unaffected. Affects BIND 9.18.0 -> 9.18.2 and version 9.19.0 of the BIND 9.19 development branch.

item.title: CVE-2022-38178|2024-09-17T02:58:12.991Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed EdDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

item.title: CVE-2022-2795|2024-09-17T03:03:19.543Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: By flooding the target resolver with queries exploiting this flaw an attacker can significantly impair the resolver's performance, effectively denying legitimate clients access to the DNS resolution service.

item.title: CVE-2020-8619|2024-09-17T03:28:34.772Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: In ISC BIND9 versions BIND 9.11.14 -> 9.11.19, BIND 9.14.9 -> 9.14.12, BIND 9.16.0 -> 9.16.3, BIND Supported Preview Edition 9.11.14-S1 -> 9.11.19-S1: Unless a nameserver is providing authoritative service for one or more zones and at least one zone contains an empty non-terminal entry containing an asterisk ("*") character, this defect cannot be encountered. A would-be attacker who is allowed to change zone content could theoretically introduce such a record in order to exploit this condition to cause denial of service, though we consider the use of this vector unlikely because any such attack would require a significant privilege level and be easily traceable.

item.title: CVE-2022-3080|2024-09-17T01:56:40.440Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: By sending specific queries to the resolver, an attacker can cause named to crash.

item.title: CVE-2021-25214|2024-09-17T00:37:21.136Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: In BIND 9.8.5 -> 9.8.8, 9.9.3 -> 9.11.29, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.13, and versions BIND 9.9.3-S1 -> 9.11.29-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.13-S1 of BIND 9 Supported Preview Edition, as well as release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.11 of the BIND 9.17 development branch, when a vulnerable version of named receives a malformed IXFR triggering the flaw described above, the named process will terminate due to a failed assertion the next time the transferred secondary zone is refreshed.

item.title: CVE-2021-25218|2024-09-17T03:07:43.591Z -- isc -- bind9
item.description: In BIND 9.16.19, 9.17.16. Also, version 9.16.19-S1 of BIND Supported Preview Edition When a vulnerable version of named receives a query under the circumstances described above, the named process will terminate due to a failed assertion check. The vulnerability affects only BIND 9 releases 9.16.19, 9.17.16, and release 9.16.19-S1 of the BIND Supported Preview Edition.
